verses.verse: (Acts 19:29; 20:4; 27:2; Philem. 24) Aristarchus my fellow prisoner greets you, with (Acts 15:37; 2 Tim. 4:11) Mark the cousin of Barnabas (about whom you received instructions: if he comes to you, welcome him),
and Jesus who is called Justus. These are my only fellow workers for the kingdom of God who are of the circumcision; they have proved to be a comfort to me.

(Col. 1:7; Philem. 23) Epaphras, who is one of you, a bondservant of Christ, greets you, always (Rom. 15:30) laboring fervently for you in prayers, that you may stand (Matt. 5:48; 1 Cor. 2:6) perfect and complete in all the will of God.
For I bear him witness that he has a great zeal for you, and those who are in Laodicea, and those in Hierapolis.
(2 Tim. 4:11; Philem. 24) Luke the beloved physician and (2 Tim. 4:10) Demas greet you.
Greet the brethren who are in Laodicea, and Nymphas and (Rom. 16:5; 1 Cor. 16:19) the church that is in his house.

Closing Exhortations and Blessing Now when (1 Thess. 5:27; 2 Thess. 3:14) this epistle is read among you, see that it is read also in the church of the Laodiceans, and that you likewise read the epistle from Laodicea.
And say to (Philem. 2) Archippus, “Take heed to (1 Tim. 4:6; 2 Tim. 4:5) the ministry which you have received in the Lord, that you may fulfill it.”
(1 Cor. 16:21; 2 Thess. 3:17) This salutation by my own hand—Paul. (Heb. 13:3) Remember my chains. Grace be with you. Amen.

Greeting Paul, (1 Pet. 5:12) Silvanus, and Timothy, To the church of the (Acts 17:1-9) Thessalonians in God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
